item.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade Director Would Like Nintendo Fans to 'Come to Accept' Game-Key Cards as 'Part of the Culture of Gaming' on Switch
item.content:encoded:
Ever since their announcement, Switch 2 Game-Key Cards have kindled much discussion and provoked strong opinions from gamers and developers alike. Latest to weigh in on Nintendo’s controversial format is Final Fantasy VII Remake trilogy director Naoki Hamaguchi. He implied that developers are choosing Game-Key Cards not necessarily from a cost perspective, but a performance one, as the format enables them to bring smoother-running games to the Switch 2.

Although Switch 2 Game-key cards are physical, they only contain a key, which requires the user to download the actual game from Nintendo’s online store. As Morningstar analyst Kazunori Ito recently summed up to Bloomberg: “The key card feels rather half-baked as it combines the drawbacks of both the physical and digital versions.”

Despite also attracting criticism from a game preservation standpoint (see Nightdive CEO Stephen Kick’s comments, for example), some developers have recently spoken out in favor of the Game-Key Card format, the latest being Final Fantasy VII Remake trilogy director Naoki Hamaguchi.

Speaking through an interpreter during a recent interview with German news site JP Games, Hamaguchi said that he understood why the Switch 2 Game-Key Card format is disliked. “I really get where people are coming from in terms of their negativity towards it, and there are good reasons,” he said. However, discussion between developers on the topic is “perhaps a bit different to what the fans maybe expect.”

Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade will make its Switch 2 debut on January 22, 2026. However, the game will only be released on a Game-key card, and there are reasons for this.

Hamaguchi explained that the major issues for those who want to release high-end, demanding games like Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade on the Switch 2 is the limited memory of the cards and their slower loading speed (in comparison to consoles with disc-based games, like PS5 and Xbox Series X and S). The smaller memory size of the cards is something that “developers can’t ignore (...) we have to work around that.”

Nintendo Switch 2 Game Boxes

The Switch 2 Game-Key Card, however, helps developers to circumnavigate around these restrictions. Hamaguchi added that Game-Key Cards can make it possible for developers to do “a semi-download version of the game,” utilizing the Switch 2’s internal storage, which can load games faster than if they were being loaded completely from the card.

Over at Ubisoft, Star Wars Outlaws’ developer Rob Bantin also recently defended Game-Key Cards from a similar standpoint, citing performance as a major reason for going down this route: “(regular) Switch 2 cards simply didn't give the performance we needed at the quality target we were going for."

In defense of the format, Hamaguchi said that he’d like for “Nintendo fans to understand the Game-Key cards and maybe come to accept them as part of the culture of gaming on Switch. (...) From a developer’s perspective, it allows us to bring more high-end experiences to Switch players, and I think that’s a good thing (...) (it lets) us do things that maybe we wouldn’t otherwise.”

This echoes previous remarks from Nintendo of America CEO Doug Bowser, who suggested that Game-Key cards help third party publishers to release bigger and more ambitious games on the Switch 2: “Game-Key Cards are a way that our publishing partners are able to bring more content onto the platform- deeper and larger, more immersive content.”

Verity Townsend is a Japan-based freelance writer who previously served as editor, contributor and translator for the game news site Automaton West. She has also written about Japanese culture and movies for various publications.

item.title: Gungrave Gore Blood Heat Trailer Reveals Remake of 2022 Action Game for PC and Consoles
item.content:encoded:
The release date has not been revealed.

A Gungrave Gore remake titled Gungrave Gore Blood Heat is officially in development for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X | S.

Studio Iggymob announced its reimagining of the 2022 cult-classic action game during the Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 broadcast today. Its reveal comes with a trailer showing off its gameplay, which has been rebuilt in Unreal Engine 5.

Iggymob calls the project a "full remake" and a "complete rebirth" for the action game it released a little less than three years ago, with general director Kay Kim saying in an Xbox Wire post that "everything about Gungrave Gore Blood Heat is an improvement on what came before." That's thanks to tweaks to things like level design, visuals, and its combat system.

“But for veteran fans, Gungrave Gore Blood Heat is a tribute to everything they’ve loved for over two decades: the brutal combat, the stylish execution, and the unflinching devotion to its world,” Kim said. “With its combination of heart-pounding action, new systems, and the tale of revenge at its core, we call Gungrave Gore Blood Heat something more than a remake. For us, it’s a ‘Complete Rebirth’. The grave has opened once more, and vengeance waits on the other side.”

Gungrave Gore Blood Heat Xbox TGS 2025 - Screenshots

You can check out everything announced at the Xbox TGS 2025 presentation while we wait for updates. For more on Gungrave, you can check out our 6/10 review of Gungrave Gore. At the time, we said, "Gungrave G.O.R.E oozes style and has a fantastic combat system, but a lack of variety, aggravating difficulty spikes, and often-frustrating design decisions keep it from reaching its full potential."

Michael Cripe is a freelance writer with IGN. He's best known for his work at sites like The Pitch, The Escapist, and OnlySP. Be sure to give him a follow on Bluesky (@mikecripe.bsky.social) and Twitter (@MikeCripe).

item.title: 007 First Light Adds Marvel Star Gemma Chan to James Bond Game Cast
item.content:encoded:
Playing new character Selina Tan.

Gemma Chan, star of Marvel's Eternals and Crazy Rich Asians, is part of the 007 First Light cast.

Chan will play Selina Tan, an original character created for Hitman developer IO Interactive's upcoming James Bond adventure.

As revealed today during the Xbox Tokyo Game Show broadcast, Chan will work alongside MI6's Q-Branch as Head of Tactical Simulation. It's the first time Chan has lent both her voice and likeness to a video game.

"Selina Tan is a senior MI6 figure who oversees the agency’s Tactical Simulations division, a program designed to test and refine the skills of Britain’s most promising recruits," reads a press release today.

"Once a rising star in academia with a background in psychology and strategy, she later made her mark in the private sector, leading advanced research in immersive technologies, before joining MI6 to spearhead the Tactical Simulation Division. Leveraging both scientific rigor and strategic vision, she is a unique asset amongst British Intelligence."

Chan joins a starry cast for 007 First Light, which is led by Dexter: Original Sin's Patrick Gibson as a new, young James Bond. Fear the Walking Dead's Lennie James co-stars as Bond's mentor John Greenway. Previous announcements have also confirmed Priyanga Burford as M, Alastair Mackenzie as Q, Kiera Lester as Moneypenny, and Noémie Nakai as Miss Roth.

“Joining the world of James Bond in video games has been such an exciting experience," Chan said in a statement today. "Selina Tan is a fascinating character, and I can’t wait for players to meet her. Bringing Selina to life in 007 First Light has been an absolute privilege."

007 First Light has set a release date of March 27, 2026, for PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S and Nintendo Switch 2.

Before then, we've got plenty more on 007 First Light, including a report on how Daniel Craig’s face was put into a Hitman map in order to secure the Bond rights, and how Queen Elizabeth II’s passing affected First Light’s development. And be sure to check out our extensive 007 First Light preview full of gameplay and story details.

item.title: Xbox at Tokyo Game Show: Everything Announced So Far (Updating Live)
item.content:encoded:
Xbox's Tokyo Game Show 2025 broadcast was filled with exciting reveals and moments, including the long-awaited reveal of Forza Horizon 6, which is actually set in Japan! We also got a look at Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's Japanese maps, Gemma Chan as Dr. Selina Tan in 007: First Light, high-level gameplay from Ninja Gaiden 4, and even Bruce Lee joining Hitman: World of Assassination as 47's partner.

There were a ton of big announcements during the show, and you can find all of the biggest ones below in one place. After you check it out, let us know what your favorite part was and what you wish had shown up!

Forza Horizon 6 Speeds to Japan in 2026

Xbox's Tokyo Game Show ended with our first look at Forza Horizon 6, which is actually located in Japan and will be released in 2026. While we didn't get to see actual cars in the open world, we were given a glimpse of a beautiful vista featuring Mount Fuji after a few fun nods to the series' past.

“For a long time, Japan has been top of Horizon fans’ wish lists, so we’re excited to finally be bringing this much-requested location to players in Forza Horizon 6,” explains art director Don Arceta to Xbox Wire. “Japan has such a unique culture – from cars, to music, to fashion – that make it perfect for the next Horizon setting. As with any Horizon title, we want to make sure we do the country justice in terms of authentic representation and Horizon open world playability – and now is the right time to realize that fully for players.”

The team also shared that the technical side of the equation is now in the right place to bring this vision to life, and they even gave the example of Forza Horizon 5's Hot Wheels DLC, which helped the team develop the elevated roads of Tokyo City.

As for where else Forza Horizon 6 will take us, the team isn't quite ready to share any more locations. However, they did give us a small tease.

“While we’re not announcing too much in terms of detail right now, we’re excited to show fans the true breadth of beauty – both natural and urban environments – that Japan has to offer,” explains Arceta. “From the neon lights and towering buildings of Tokyo City – one of our most detailed and layered environments to date – to the serenity and natural beauty of Japan’s rural and mountain areas, we think players will be blown away by the open world of Japan that we have built."

Japan also has a long and storied history with cars, and Playground Games is doing all it can to honor that.

"In Japanese car culture, the depth and diversity is astonishing,” Cultural consultant Kyoko Yamashita said. “Kei cars and vans with cult followings, precision motorsport, drifting’s roots, and their passion for customization really stands out. It’s welcoming to different levels of enthusiasm and knowledge, which is exactly the kind of layered world I want players to feel.”

And of course Forza Horizon 6 will have changing seasons, which will all pay homage to Japan's "sweltering summers, snowy winters and, of course, the iconic Sakura season, those precious weeks where cherry blossoms bloom across the country."

“The team has also been able to build a system where seasonal changes truly inform the world – how spring, summer, autumn, and winter subtly shift tone, activity, and sound,” explains Yamashita. “The team is also really proud of the attention to everyday details: ambient audio like station chimes or summer wind bells that instantly place you without a caption. Those are quiet choices, but they carry a lot of truth.”

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Showcases Multiplayer Maps Set in Japan

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will feature two maps set in Japan and they were both showcased during Xbox's TGS stream. Toshin was first up and it looks to be set in 2035 Tokyo. Furthermore, it will combine "well-defined lanes and some really fun set pieces - including a cat cafe, a karaoke bar, and a crashed train."

Den is the second one and will offer a "different vibe." This map is set in the countryside outside Tokyo and "centers around a Japanese castle that's been repurposed as a Guild base."

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will be released on November 14, and the Early Access Beta will start on October 2 before the Open Beta kicks off on October 5.

007: First Light Casts Eternals' Gemma Chan as Dr. Selina Tan

007: First Light not only was featured during the stream with quick looks at gameplay, but we were also introduced to MI6's Head of Tactical Simulation, Gemma Chan's Dr. Selina Tan. For those unfamiliar, Chan has previously been seen in Eternals, Raya and the Last Dragon, and Crazy Rich Asians.

"Selina oversees a cutting-edge program designed to test and refine the skills of MI6’s most promising recruits," the official description reads of the brand-new character. "With her background in psychology, strategy, and immersive technologies, she is as formidable as she is innovative."

Ninja Gaiden 4 Gameplay Overview Features Master Ninja Difficulty Action and Training Mode

Ahead of its release on October 21, Ninja Gaiden took center stage at Xbox's TGS stream to showcase not only its training mode that will let you practice combos and weapons in a safe place, but also its Master Ninja mode.

Unlocked after beating Story Mode, Master Ninja will challenge players with feature late-game enemies in earlier chapters, enhanced AI, a greater number of enemies at once, and much more. For those looking for an even greater challenge, there is a setting called Death Wish mode where "growth elements are reset, and difficulty can be escalated towards an even harsher extreme."

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection Gets a Story Trailer, First Two Monster Hunter Stories Games Headed to Xbox in November

A new story trailer was revealed for Monster Hunter Stories 3: Reflection, and it was also revealed that the original Monster Hunter Stories and Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin will be headed to Xbox Series X/S on November 14, 2025.

Bruce Lee Is Joining Hitman: World of Assassination as Your Partner

The legendary Bruce Lee is joining Hitman: World of Assassination as 47's partner later today in a new Elusive Mission. 47 will need to identify threats and protect Bruce Lee and work together with him to bring down this threat.

Lee will play a character named Agent Lee, a character trying to infiltrate the Concorn Union in Hong Kong. The mission, called The Infiltrator, will take place at the Himmapan Hotel in Bangkok, where the Concord Union is hosting a secret international martial arts tournament. Agent Lee needs to win this tournament and identify the leader of the Concorn Union, and he needs 47 to help him do so. There will even be new mechanics to help 47 be the ultimate protector, which is a change from his usual missions.

The Infiltrator will be available from September 25 - November 20.

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024's World Update 20 Is Out Today and Adds a Lot of Detail to Japan Locations

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024's World Update 20 is out today and adds a ton of detail to locations in Japan, including Mount Fuji, Hiroshima's Peace Memorial Park, Naruto's Otsuka Museum of Art, the Port of Kobe, Osaka Castle, Kyoto, Todaiji Temple, and so many more. In total, there are 23 areas of interest and 67 points of interest to explore, five new airports, more immersive missions, and it's all free.

Oh, and the update will also add Local Legend #22: NAMC YS-11 for players to fly for $19.99.

Gungrave Gore Blood Heat Lets You Dualwield Guns and Use a Massive One As a Weapon and a Shield

Gunegrave Gore Blood Heat is a remake of 2022's Gungrave Gore and its "newly added systems preserve the legacy while delivering a modern and more explosive feel." These updates will be felt in level design, motion, visuals, player interactions, combat system, and more.

And yes, you'll be playing as Beyond the Grave, who was once known as Brandon Heat, and will have full access to his dual Cerberus pistols and the gigantic Death Hauler that can be used as a weapon and a shield.

Age of Mythology: Heavenly Spear Is a New Expansion Set in Japan, and It's Out Next Week

Age of Mythology: Retold's Heavenly Spear expansion is out next week and will take players to Japan, where they will encounter a fresh story alongside new gods, powers, and more. There will be 12 missions to undertake, and they will focus on Yasuko, a "farmer's daughter who takes on a new destiny when she discovers a magical spear."

"As war looms and chaos spreads across the land, Yasuko must uncover the relic’s secrets and prevent it from falling into the hands of Kagemasa, a ruthless warlord who seeks to imprison the sun goddess Amaterasu and claim godhood for himself," the official description continues.

Heavenly Spear will debut on September 30, 2025.

Dragon Quest I & II 2D-HD Remake Reveals Ocean Floor Area

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake will arrive on October 30 and will be more than just the games we know and love. Today's stream showed off the Ocean Floor area, which will have players meeting a mermaid, exploring the "desecrated" underwater town of Mersea, and figuring out what exactly happening in this hidden region set beneath the waves.

Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake's Director Speaks on What Makes This Version a Must-Play

PlayStation 2's Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly from 2003 is getting a new remake in early 2026 and director Makoto Shibata spoke on what makes this version a must-play, including graphical and audio enhancements, how the Camera Obscura evolved, and new action additions that will help players during the game's hardest moments.

Swery and Suda51 Stopped by Xbox's Show to Play Hotel Barcelona's Multiplayer Modes

Hidetaka "Swery" Suehiro and Goichi "Suda51" Suda stopped by Xbox's show to play Hotel Barcelona's multiplayer modes ahead of its launch date of September 26. These modes will include three-player co-op and a PvP invasion system where "invaders step into someone else’s run and become adversarial
doppelgängers, locked in mortal combat until one player falls – with rewards given to the victor."

Double Dragon Revive's Extra Mode Adds More Challenge Past Story Mode

Double Dragon Revive is set to be released on October 23, and it will come with challenging Extra Mode that will provide even more reasons to play after the story mode has ended. This mode wil lfeature over 50 missions and will unlock character-specific missions that will tell even more of the story of the game.

Aniimo Gameplay Showcases New Creatures to Catch and How They Intereact With Each Other and the World Around Them

The upcoming ARPG Aniimo was featured today and the footage we saw showcased some of the creatures players will be attempting to catch and also how they will interact with each other and the world around them.

One example was Stellarys, the Rainy Form evolution of Celestis that can only happen in the wild if it evolves while it's raining. This means you can't evolve Celestis this way and need to capture it in the wild.

For another example, Xbox Wire shared the following;

"You might notice that Helgon and Helmuts have an interesting exchange in the trailer. Helgon provoke Helmuts because they can see their weakness – leading to Helmuts evolving in corresponding ways. Most Helmuts will evolve to Rookguard, which have the capacity to turn into a giant metal sphere to protect them from Helgon. Only the bravest Helmut will evolve to Pawney to challenge Infregon, the Helgon family’s boss."

Winter Burrow Is a Cozy Woodland Survival Game I Need Right Now

Winter Burrow is a cozy woodland survival game and it stars a young city mouse who returns to the wild. The game is narrated by an older mouse through nursery rhymes, which will actually help you survive the harsh winter. Don't worry, as you will meet friends along the way and work to build a place to thrive instead of just survive.

WInter Burrow will be released on November 12, 2025.

Mistfall Hunter's Second Map, Solemn Needles, Revealed

Solemn Needles is Mistfall Hunter's second map that will be available at launch, and it is set within a "bleached and sacred forest." It also features the Divine Anchor - a "relic whose lingering power draws enemies – alongside Hastine’s Fall, where the corpse of a giant still radiates divine strength, and the shadowed Witchery Woods, dense with secrets."

Project Evilbane Wants You to Bring Three Friends With You to Fight for Humanity

We were treated to another look at Project Evilbane, the upcoming 4-player co-op Action-RPG that will have players fighting for humanity against a threat unlike any that's ever been seen before.

Rhythm Doctor Is One of the Only Games to Be Able to 'Act as a Video Editor For Its Own Trailer'

Rhythm Doctor is a very unique game as, according to Xbox Wire, it it one of "the only games in existence able to act as a video editor for its own trailer." The whole trailer wasa made without any cuts, and all of the effects and shots and jumps between songs were all accomplished in teh game.

See how it all works for yourself when Rhythm Doctor launches on December 6.

Romancing Saga 2: Revenge of the Seven Is Available Now on Xbox

Romancing Saga 2: Revenge of the Seven, the full 3D remake of the original 1993 RPG, is now available on Xbox Series X/S and Xbox on PC, complete with new features like Surprise Attack and United Attack.

Starsand Island's CG Trailer Invites Us to a Cozy Island

Get ready to farm and build near the beautiful sea in Starsand Island, which also seems to including some multiplayer elements that may make this adventure even more fun with friends.

Sudden Strike 5 Brings Strategic WWII Action to Xbox in 2026

Generals take note, as Sudden Strike 5 is bringing strategic WWII action to Xbox in 2026. This new entry comes with an enhanced Doctrine System and plenty of secondary objectives that will help you ensure a strong and commanding victory.

Terminull Brigade Gets a Neon Genesis Evangelion Crossover and Xbox Release

Journey back to the Nullverse in Terminull Brigade with its Neon Genesis Evangelion crossover, and now players can do so on Xbox and Xbox on PC, giving even more options to experience it all.

item.title: Forza Horizon 6 Set in Japan, Launches 2026
item.content:encoded:
UPDATE: Microsoft has now formally announced Forza Horizon 6 during today's big Xbox Tokyo Game Show broadcast and revealed that it will release first for PC and Xbox console, before then arriving on PlayStation 5 "post-launch".

"The teams at Playground Games and Turn 10 have poured their hearts into Forza Horizon 6, bringing Japan to life like never before," said Xbox exec Matt Booty, finally making the game's reveal official. "This has been the most-requested location since the very first game and we can't wait to share more next year."

It’s Japan. #ForzaHorizon6 pic.twitter.com/D6HngHj43g

— Forza Horizon (@ForzaHorizon) September 25, 2025

An Xbox Wire blog post on the game's announcement goes into more detail on why Japan has been chosen now specifically, with art director Don Arceta revealing that recent technical advances had made the game possible.

"The beauty of Horizon games is that each one gives us learnings and ways to make the next even bigger and better," Arceta said. "As well as taking player feedback into account, we’ve also been able to lean into more practical things – for instance, the Forza Horizon 5 Hot Wheels DLC has helped us develop the elevated roads of Tokyo City in FH6.”

As evidenced from today's teaser, the game will mix Tokyo's urban environment with a sample of Japan's rural areas, including Mount Fuji. The series' usual seasonal changes will also return, Arceta confirmed.

ORIGINAL STORY: Forza Horizon 6, the next entry in Microsoft's racing series, will be set in Japan and launch in 2026.

Microsoft made the announcement via a post on Instagram, which has gone live several hours before today's big Xbox Tokyo Game Show broadcast.

The post shows a brief teaser for Forza Horizon 6, confirming its setting and release year. "The Horizon Festival is heading to Japan," reads a caption. "Coming 2026. Wishlist now!" Logos confirm the game will be an Xbox Play Anywhere title, and unsurprisingly also launch on Xbox Game Pass.

While today's announcement looks to have gone live a little early, nothing from today's announcement comes as much of a surprise. Microsoft gaming chief Phil Spencer previously confirmed a fresh entry in the Forza series would launch in 2026, and with Forza Motorsport's team reportedly gutted in the company's recent layoffs, it seemed obvious this referred to a fresh Forza Horizon entry instead.

Forza fans have also had their eye on Japan for a while, as well — particularly after a teasing social media post last month from a car import company connected to the game.

Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social
